pageContext.claim: “I have great feeling for DACA. I think that we should be able to do something with DACA. I think it's foolish if we don't, they've been here a long time, they're no longer children, you know. People talk of them as children, I mean some are 41 years old and older.”
pageContext.analysis: There are currently about 690,000 people enrolled in DACA, or Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals. The program is only open to those born after June 15, 1981, so DACA recipients can be no more than 36 years old. On average, they are 25 years old.
